item.title: Automatically locking a git crypt repo
item.description: I’ve been using Git Crypt with a few secure git repos at work. It works well and is easy to use. The one thing that occasionally wakes me up in the middle of the night is wondering if I’ve locked a repo when I’m finished with it. To help with this issue, I threw together a quick bash function using at and wall. I use this on both Debian Linux and OSX.
